clinical_study.brief_title: Nursing Activity and Quality of Hospitalized Patients' Sleep
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Night Nursing Activity on the Quality of Hospitalized Patients' Sleep

collaborator.agency: Professeur Pierre-Yves Marie, Cédric Baumann, Katie Galois, Romuald Zadra, Virginie Simon, Martine Lesny, Edith Dauchy, Saliha Sammari, Sylvie Klein

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to determine the impact of night shift nurse's activity on patients' sleeping patterns in medical services including individual, clinical and environmental factors. The patients will be questioned in order to create both a control group and a group with troubled sleeping patterns.

detailed_description.textblock:
There are 5 speciality medical units involved. Patients must respond to the define inclusion criteria. Each patient will be asked if they agree to participate and if so will be asked to consent to participate.
Every day, nurses will give a questionnaire which will be completed by the patient to know if there were troubles sleeping patterns. If so, a second questionnaire will be completed by the patient.
Other data will be recorded such as personal informations, diagnostic, medical history, consumption habits and treatments.
The inclusion phase lasts 15 days maximum.

primary_outcome.measure: Presence of a sleeping disorder partially or totally related, according to patient's opinion, to night nursing activity
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of participation of patient- maximum at day 15 after inclusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Part of patients declaring disturbing elements related to night nursing activity
secondary_outcome.description: A follow up sheet is completed every day by a study nurse who asks to patient if the patient sleeps well during the previous night

secondary_outcome.measure: Disturbing elements related to night nursing activity
secondary_outcome.description: A follow up sheet is completed every day by a study nurse who asks to patient what was the disturbing elements according to him
A follow up sheet is completed every day by a study nurse who asks to patient what was the disturbing elements according to him

secondary_outcome.measure: Average length of patients' sleep in patients with troubled sleeping during hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Estimated with the Vis Morgen self administered questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Sleep quality measured by Spiegel score

arm_group.description: First questionnaire (spiegel questionnaire) will allow a score on 30. If the score is > 18, the patient will be in the control group.
First questionnaire (spiegel questionnaire) will allow a score on 30. If the score is < 18, the patient will be in the troubled patterns group.

intervention.description: Ask patients about sleep quality and identify reasons of troubled sleeping patterns in the units.

study_pop.textblock: Patients hospitalized in a speciality medical units and who respond to the defined inclusion criteria. 5 units participate: nephrologye, neurology, cardiology, pneumology, endocrinology.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient hospitalize in medical units
- In the unit since one night
- Patient over 18 years old
- Patient agree to participate
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient who can't answer to the questionnaire for health reasons
- Patient who need a specific surveillance
- Patient recently operated
